page.title: 20Fish
page.content: In the North-East of the block along the banks of the King's Sedgemoor Drain one can usually see anglers. The most common fish are Perch and Pike which because they need to be able to see their prey avoid opaque muddy water. The state of the other rivers and drains is such that these fish are not found in them. However bottom feeding fish are quite common. Tench thrives particularly where there is rich aquatic plant life. In spring vast numbers of elvers enter the Severn Estuary and make their way up the rivers. They are about 7cm long and 3 years old. If they are not caught (they are a local delicacy) they move out into all the rhines feeding on worms and whatever aquatic lifeforms they can find. The males grow to 60cms and the females to 150 cms.
